channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Simon Schama's Power of Art
channel.desc: Simon Schama recounts the story of eight moments of drama in the making of eight great works of art. He looks at Jacques Louis David's revolutionary painting Death of Marat.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Jackal Speaks - Storyville
channel.desc: A Storyville documentary in which Ilich Ramirez Sanchez, better known globally as Carlos the Jackal, tells his story from the confines of a French high-security prison.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Bernardine Evaristo
channel.desc: Alan Yentob explores the life and work of Anglo-Nigerian author Bernardine Evaristo. Contains some strong language.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: How the Wild West Was Won with Ray Mears
channel.desc: How the Great Plains saw stories of Indians, wagon trains, homesteaders and cattle drives. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Wainwright Walks
channel.desc: Documentary series. After visiting Richmond, Julia Bradbury crosses the vale between the Dales and her last National Park, the North York Moors.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Great British Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo continues his 1936 Bradshaw's-inspired railway tour of north Wales in the coastal city of Bangor, before turning south to Betws-y-Coed, the gateway to Snowdonia.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Simon Schama's Power of Art
channel.desc: Simon Schama recounts the story of eight moments of drama in the making of eight great works of art. He looks at Jacques Louis David's revolutionary painting Death of Marat.

channel.title: Wainwright Walks
channel.desc: Julia Bradbury sets out on the final stage of her walk. Robin Hood's Bay is the goal, but first she must complete the North York Moors and walk through Eskdale.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Digging for Britain
channel.desc: The best in British archaeology. Finds include Roman letters that reveal what London was like, an East India ship packed with silver, and evidence of Julius Caesar in Britain.

channel.title: Andrew Davies
channel.desc: A profile of Britain's best-known screenwriter as he embarks on Les Miserables. Deals with adult themes.

channel.title: Andrew Davies Remembers... Pride and Prejudice
channel.desc: Andrew Davies discusses how he turned Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice into the costume drama series that had a whole nation of viewers gripped.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Pride and Prejudice
channel.desc: The arrival of Mr Bingley causes great excitement within the Bennet family. One of her five daughters, Mrs Bennet feels, is sure to capture the heart of the young aristocrat.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Pride and Prejudice
channel.desc: Mr Bennet's estranged cousin, Mr Collins, writes to announce his imminent visit to Longbourn, the house he will inherit on Mr Bennet's death.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Pride and Prejudice
channel.desc: Elizabeth receives an astounding piece of news and Jane's sweet nature is put to the test when she hears that Bingley and his sisters have left Netherfield Park.

channel.desc: Rejected by Elizabeth, Darcy returns to Rosings Park and writes to her, revealing the truth about Wickham.

channel.desc: Dramatisation of Jane Austen's classic story. Darcy is pleased to introduce Elizabeth to his sister, Georgiana, and to welcome her, and her aunt and uncle, to Pemberley.

channel.title: Pride and Prejudice
channel.desc: A dramatisation of Jane Austen's classic story. There is great excitement in the neighbourhood when Bingley returns to Netherfield, bringing Darcy with him.

channel.desc: Engineer Rob Bell explores the new inventions - from giant troop-carrying gliders to tanks that could operate on water - that made the Normandy invasion in 1944 possible.

channel.desc: Sir Bryn Terfel, Juan Diego Florez and Yuja Wang are among guests in a star-studded gala featuring the music of Bizet and Ravel to mark the 150th anniversary of Palais Garnier.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Many Faces of Alison Steadman
channel.desc: Documentary in which actress Alison Steadman talks about her career, from her earliest appearances on screen. Featuring archive footage and testimony from friends and colleagues.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Alison Steadman Remembers... Girl
channel.desc: Alison Steadman tells the story of groundbreaking 1974 TV drama Girl. Once thought lost forever, the film later resurfaced, giving Alison the opportunity to share her memories.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Second City Firsts
channel.desc: 1970s drama. Just as she is about to leave the army, Jackie has an encounter with an old lover. Stars Alison Steadman in an early TV role. Contains language which some may find offensive.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Gateways Grind
channel.desc: Sandi Toksvig goes behind the iconic green door of one of the most famous lesbian venues in the world, The Gateways Club.
